docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 9 -- Generalissimo Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina lies in a crypt in the $250,000 church he erected in his native town of San Cristobal. The regime he put together in thirty-one years as the strong man here...
docs.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 9 -- Generalissimo Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina lies in a crypt in the $250,000 church he erected in his native town of San Cristobal. The regime he put together in thirty-one years as the strong man here runs on -perhaps even more smoothly.

byline.original: By PETER KIHSS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LATIN America today is ripe for revolution. Cuba is already convulsed; Ecuador is but a step from the revolutionary brink. Constitutional order in Colombia and Venezuela, only precariously maintained, may break down at any moment. Even sturdy Costa...
docs.lead_paragraph: LATIN America today is ripe for revolution. Cuba is already convulsed; Ecuador is but a step from the revolutionary brink. Constitutional order in Colombia and Venezuela, only precariously maintained, may break down at any moment. Even sturdy Costa Rica and democratic Uruguay are not immune to the enormous forces of change that are shaking the region.
docs.abstract: J Plank urges US effort to harness revolutionary currents sweeping Latin Amer to prevent their being turned against it, article; illus

headline.main: What Policy for Latin America?; If the revolutionary currents sweeping the hemisphere are not to turn against us, we must learn to identify ourselves with the demands for constructive change. The French in Algeria

docs.snippet: Continued weakness in the British pound sterling was the main point of interest in the foreign exchange market last week. Canadian dollar showed a steady undertone in the fore part of the week then eased slightly in the closing sessions.

docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 12 -- Maj. Gen. Jose Rene Roman Fernandez will be tried by court-martial for treason for his part in the May 30 assassination of Generalissimo Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina, the Dominican Republic's strong...
docs.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 12 -- Maj. Gen. Jose Rene Roman Fernandez will be tried by court-martial for treason for his part in the May 30 assassination of Generalissimo Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina, the Dominican Republic's strong man, the General Staff announced tonight.

headline.main: DOMINICAN TRIAL SET FOR GENERAL; Suspect in Trujillo Slaying Liable to Death Penalty

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 12 -- The United States, seeking new concepts of economic aid to Latin-American nations, is negotiating with Western European countries to increase their purchases of products from the Western Hemisphere.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 12 -- The United States, seeking new concepts of economic aid to Latin-American nations, is negotiating with Western European countries to increase their purchases of products from the Western Hemisphere.

headline.main: U.S. BIDS EUROPE BUY FROM LATINS; Negotiates to Increase Flow of Hemisphere's Trade

docs.snippet: A very strange extension of the "new frontier" is the effort of the Kennedy Administration to perpetuate, and even to increase, military aid to Latin America. The long course of history, and especially the events of recent years, have shown that such...
docs.lead_paragraph: A very strange extension of the "new frontier" is the effort of the Kennedy Administration to perpetuate, and even to increase, military aid to Latin America. The long course of history, and especially the events of recent years, have shown that such a policy strengthens the military, favors dictators, and forces the individual countries to spend far more on defense than they can afford.

docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 14 -- The subcommittee of the Organization of American States investigating political conditions in the Dominican Republic completed its interviews here today. The committee members are due to leave for...
docs.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 14 -- The subcommittee of the Organization of American States investigating political conditions in the Dominican Republic completed its interviews here today. The committee members are due to leave for Washington tomorrow to report.
